definition: a single spark can start a huge blaze (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
pinyin: xing1 xing5 zhi1 huo3 , ke3 yi3 liao2 yuan2

sentences.english: Think all friends having read Liaoyuan's essay.
sentences.chinese: 感謝所有閱讀完燎原文章的朋友。

sentences.english: Jiangyin Liaoyuan Forging and Stamping Co. , Ltd. is a member of China Forge & Metalforming Association and a key forging manufacturer in China;
sentences.chinese: 江陰市燎原鍛壓有限公司是中國鍛壓協會的會員單位。

sentences.english: The single spark that started the prairie fire suggests the answer.
sentences.chinese: 引發燎原之火的火花暗示了答案。

sentences.english: At present investment-security-fund industry is in rapid development stage.
sentences.chinese: 目前證券投資基金業正以星火燎原之勢蓬勃發展。

sentences.english: A little fire is quickly trodden out, which, being suffered, rivers cannot quench.
sentences.chinese: 星星之火一旦燎原，則江河之水難撲滅。

sentences.english: Just like fire, burnin' up the way.
sentences.chinese: 就如同星星之火，順勢燎原。

sentences.english: A single spark can start a prairie fire, where smoking is prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 星火可以燎原，此處嚴禁吸菸。

definition: a single spark (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
spark/meteor trail (mostly used in expressions like 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3])
a single spark can start a huge blaze (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
pinyin: xing1 xing5 zhi1 huo3 , ke3 yi3 liao2 yuan2

definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
wildfire/(spreading like) wildfire/bush fire/farm fire (for clearing fields)
tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces
